content: f michele designed by sarah punderson 2 versions of the same hat one slightly slouchy and one very slouchy a simple slip_stitch pattern is used for the body of this hat worked in the round easy to memorize and great for variegated yarns the very slouchy hat is fuller and longer included in the pattern are photos a complete list of abbreviations and a stitch glossary skill level advanced beginner yarn plymouth yarn happy feet dk 90% superwash merino wool 10% nylon 262yds 100g 1skein substitute yarn any dk weight yarn can be used as long as you match gauge yarns of different fiber content and twist will give a slightly different look any variegated or handspun yarns would be fine for an even slouchier version use a drapey yarn one with some silk or bamboo or a single ply yarn the slightly slouchy version uses about 200yds and the very slouchy version uses about 250yds needles & notions 16in circular needle us 5/3 75mm 16in circular needle us 6/4 25mm 1 set us 6/4 25mm double-pointed needles 2 circulars or 1 long circular magic loop for crown decreases 1 stitch marker tapestry needle gauge 22 sts = 4in/10cm in stockinette stitch pattern with us 6/4 25mm needles or size needed to obtain gauge style b happy feet dk color 54 model lena sizes one size fits all pattern notes this hat is worked from the bottom up instructions the slightly slouchy hat is style a and the very style a happy feet dk color 61 slouchy version is style b instructions for the very slouchy version style b are either in parenthesis or in a separate sentence with smaller needles co 100 sts pm join in the round being careful not to twist stitches work k1 p1 rib for 2in switch to larger needles increase as follows style a *k2 kfb* repeat to last 4 sts k4 style b *k1 kfb k2 kfb* repeat to end of round 132 140 sts round 1 k5 6 sl1 always slip_stitch purlwise going into the stitch as if to purl round 2 knit repeat these 2 rounds until piece measures 6 5 8 in from co edge ending on row 2 crown shaping switch to double-pointed needles 2 circulars or long circular when necessary round 1 *k2tog k3 4 sl1* repeat to end of round 110 120 sts round 2 and all even rnds knit round 3 *k4 5 sl1* repeat to end of round round 5 *k2tog k2 3 sl1 k4 5 sl1* repeat to end of round 99 110 sts round 7 *k3 4 sl1 k4 5 sl1* repeat to end of round round 9 *k3 4 sl1 k2tog k2 3 sl1* repeat to end of round 88 100 sts round 11 style a *k2tog k1 sl1 k3 sl1* repeat to end of round style b *k4 sl1* repeat to end of round 77 100 sts round 13 style a *k2 sl1 k2tog k1 sl1* repeat to end of round
